Story 11.6: Expose Publication Abstracts in Templates

Context: The Publication model already has an abstract field (max 500 chars) used for JD-relevant curation. This story would expose abstracts in templates so users can optionally display them on their resume.

Implementation Notes

Template Changes:
  • Add show_abstracts config option (default: false)
  • Update executive.html publications block to conditionally render abstracts
  • Add CSS classes for abstract styling
  • Respect publications_curated flag (only show abstracts if JD-curated)

Config Options: 
# .resume.yaml
template_options:
  show_publication_abstracts: true  # default: false
  abstract_style: inline  # inline | block | compact
  abstract_max_length: 150  # truncate for compact style

Use Cases

When to show abstracts:
  • CTO/Executive roles: Demonstrates thought leadership depth
  • Academic/Research positions: Shows research contributions
  • Highly curated resumes: When only 2-3 publications are shown, abstracts add value
  • Conference speaker roles: Helps recruiters understand talk content

When to hide abstracts (default):
  • Space-constrained resumes: Abstracts add 50-100% more lines
  • Many publications: 5+ publications with abstracts becomes unwieldy
  • ATS optimization: Some ATS systems parse better with minimal formatting
